intro: Pionandra oxyphylla, commonly known as the flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its large, showy red flowers that appear in clusters, often resembling flames. The plant has palmate leaves that are typically divided into five to seven lobes. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a popular ornamental species. Pionandra oxyphylla is also valued for its ability to provide habitat and food for various wildlife species.
